statements: SELECT * FROM Student_Info;
SELECT name, email FROM Student_Info WHERE enrollment_status = 'Active';
SELECT email, name FROM Student_Info WHERE enrollment_status = 'Inactive';
SELECT * FROM Student_Info ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT name, email FROM Student_Info WHERE name LIKE '%John%';
SELECT * FROM Student_Info WHERE enrollment_status = 'active';
SELECT name, email FROM Student_Info WHERE enrollment_status = 'inactive';
SELECT * FROM Student_Info ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT name, enrollment_status FROM Student_Info WHERE email LIKE '%gmail.com';
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_students FROM Student_Info WHERE enrollment_status = 'active';
SELECT * FROM students;
SELECT name, email FROM students WHERE enrollment_status = 'active';
SELECT id, course_name FROM courses ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT id, name, email FROM students WHERE enrollment_status = 'inactive';
SELECT course_name, credits FROM courses WHERE credits > 3;
SELECT * FROM students WHERE enrollment_status='Active';
SELECT name, email FROM students WHERE id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT course_name, credits FROM courses ORDER BY credits DESC;
SELECT * FROM students JOIN courses ON students.id = courses.id;
SELECT name, course_name FROM students INNER JOIN courses ON students.id = courses.id WHERE credits > 3;
SELECT * FROM students
SELECT name, email FROM students
SELECT course_name, instructor FROM courses
SELECT * FROM enrollments
SELECT student_id, course_id FROM enrollments
SELECT * FROM students WHERE enrollment_status = 'active';
SELECT name, email FROM students WHERE id > 5 ORDER BY name DESC;

SELECT students.name, courses.course_name FROM students JOIN enrollments ON students.id = enrollments.student_id JOIN courses ON courses.course_id = enrollments.course_id WHERE students.enrollment_status = 'inactive';

SELECT students.name AS student_name, courses.course_name AS course_name, courses.instructor AS instructor FROM students JOIN enrollments ON students.id = enrollments.student_id JOIN courses ON courses.course_id = enrollments.course_id WHERE students.id = 3;

SELECT students.name, COUNT(enrollments.course_id) AS num_courses FROM students LEFT JOIN enrollments ON students.id = enrollments.student_id GROUP BY students.name HAVING num_courses > 1 ORDER BY num_courses DESC;
SELECT * FROM students;
SELECT name, email FROM students WHERE enrollment_status='active';
SELECT course_name FROM courses ORDER BY course_name ASC;
SELECT student_id, name, enrollment_status FROM students WHERE enrollment_status='inactive';

SELECT g.grade_id, c.course_name, s.name FROM grades g JOIN enrollments e ON g.enrollment_id = e.enrollment_id JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id JOIN students s ON e.student_id = s.student_id;
SELECT * FROM students WHERE enrollment_status = 'Active';
SELECT name, email FROM students WHERE student_id = 1;
SELECT course_name FROM courses WHERE course_id = 3;
SELECT student_id, course_id FROM enrollments WHERE student_id = 2;
SELECT student_id, course_id, grade FROM enrollments INNER JOIN grades ON enrollments.enrollment_id = grades.enrollment_id WHERE grade = 'A';
SELECT * FROM students;
SELECT id, name, email FROM students WHERE enrollment_status = 'enrolled';
SELECT course_name, course_code FROM courses ORDER BY course_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM enrollments WHERE enrollment_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT AVG(grade) AS avg_grade FROM grades WHERE course_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM students;
SELECT name, email FROM students WHERE enrollment_status = 'enrolled';
SELECT course_name, course_code FROM courses ORDER BY course_name DESC;
SELECT students.name, courses.course_name, grades.grade FROM students INNER JOIN grades ON students.id = grades.student_id INNER JOIN courses ON grades.course_id = courses.id;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_students FROM students;
